name: Larry A. WITTIG, Petitioner, v. Michael F. RUDELITCH and Lori A. Rudelitch, Respondents; Michael F. RUDELITCH and Lori A. Rudelitch, Respondents, v. Larry A. WITTIG, Douglas R. Haas and Denise Haas, Petitioners

parties: Larry A. WITTIG, Petitioner, v. Michael F. RUDELITCH and Lori A. Rudelitch, Respondents. Michael F. RUDELITCH and Lori A. Rudelitch, Respondents, v. Larry A. WITTIG, Douglas R. Haas and Denise Haas, Petitioners.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
AND NOW, this 18th day of June, 1998, the Petitions for Allowance of Appeal are hereby GRANTED, limited to the following issue:
May a person claiming an easement by prescription tack the use by a predecessor in title when there is no reference to the easement in the deed of conveyance?
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: James R. Nanovic, Jim Thorpe, for petitioner.
casebody.head_matter:
711 A.2d 472
Larry A. WITTIG, Petitioner, v. Michael F. RUDELITCH and Lori A. Rudelitch, Respondents. Michael F. RUDELITCH and Lori A. Rudelitch, Respondents, v. Larry A. WITTIG, Douglas R. Haas and Denise Haas, Petitioners.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
June 18, 1998.
James R. Nanovic, Jim Thorpe, for petitioner.
